data.title: Kingdom of Wurttemberg
data.meta_description: Kingdom of Wurttemberg - House of Wurttemberg
data.text:
The Kingdom of Württemberg (German: Königreich Württemberg) was a state that existed from 1806 to 1918, located in the area that is now Baden-Württemberg, Germany. The kingdom was a continuation of the Duchy of Württemberg, which came into existence in 1495. Prior to 1495, the ruling house of Württemberg had consisted of counts ruling only a fragment of the Duchy of Swabia, which had dissolved after the death of Conrad I in 1268.

The border of the Kingdom of Württemberg, as defined in 1813, was situated between 47°34' and 49°35' North and 8°15' and 10°30' East. The greatest distance north-south was 225 km and the greatest east-west was 160 km. The border had a total length of 1800 km. The total area of the state was 19,508 km². It shared a boundary on the East with Bavaria, and on the other three sides with Baden, with the exception of a short distance on the south, where it bordered Hohenzollern and Lake Constance.

The Dukes and Kings of Wurttemberg

Dukes of Württemberg Image Name Began Ended Notes Eberhard I 21 July 1495 24 February 1496 Eberhard II 24 February 1496 11 June 1498 Ulrich 11 June 1498 January 1519 Deposed Württemberg annexed by Austria 1519-1534 Ulrich May 1534 6 November 1550 Restored Christoph 6 November 1550 28 December 1568 Ludwig III 28 December 1568 18 August 1593 Friedrich I 18 August 1593 29 January 1608 Johann Friedrich 29 January 1608 18 July 1628 Eberhard III 18 July 1628 2 July 1674 Wilhelm Ludwig 2 July 1674 23 June 1677 Eberhard Ludwig 23 June 1677 31 October 1733 Karl Alexander 31 October 1733 12 March 1737 Also regent of Kingdom of Serbia from 1720 to 1733 Karl Eugen 12 March 1737 24 October 1793 Ludwig Eugen 24 October 1793 20 May 1795 Friedrich Eugen 20 May 1795 23 December 1797 Friedrich II 23 December 1797 25 February 1803

In 1803, the Duke of Württemberg was raised to the rank of Elector of the Holy Roman Empire. In 1806, the Empire became dormant, and the Elector of Württemberg became an independent monarch with the title of King.

Elector of Württemberg 1803-1806

Elector of Württemberg Image Name Began Ended Notes Friedrich II 25 February 1803 1 January 1806

Kings of Württemberg 1806-1918

The Holy Roman Empire came to an end in 1806. The Elector of Württemberg, allied to Napoleon I, anticipated its dissolution by becoming the ruler of an independent Kingdom of Württemberg in 1806.

Kings of Württemberg Image Name Began Ended Notes Frederick I

Friedrich I 1 January 1806 30 October 1816 William I

Wilhelm I 30 October 1816 25 June 1864 Son of Frederick I. Charles I

Karl I 25 June 1864 6 October 1891 Son of William I. Became a subordinate ruler in the German Empire in 1871. William II

Wilhelm II 6 October 1891 29 November 1918 Nephew of Charles I. Last king of Württemberg. Lost his throne in the German revolutions of 1918.

Because of a lack of male heirs under Salic law, on the death of Wilhelm II in 1921 the royal house had to reach back to the descendants of Friedrich II Eugen (ruled 1795-97). The line of the Duke of Urach was excluded because of a morganatic marriage back in 1800 by its forbear Duke William, and so the succession devolved to the younger branch of Altshausen. Another morganatic descendant of Friedrich II Eugen was Mary of Teck (1867-1953), who married the British king George V when he was Duke of York.

Heads of the House of Württemberg since 1918

The legal line of succession of the house of Württemberg has continued to the present, although the house no longer plays any political role. For later rulers, see List of Ministers-President of Württemberg.

King Wilhelm II, 1918-1921.

Duke Albrecht, 1921-1939.

Duke Philipp, 1939-1975.

Duke Carl, since 1975.

The Family Titles and Styles

The members of this family bear the title Duke or Duchess of Württemberg (Royal Highness). Direct descendants of the Kings of Württemberg bore the title Prince or Princess of Württemberg (Royal Highness).

FRIEDRICH II EUGEN, Duke of Württemberg 20 May 1795 (Stuttgart 21 Jan 1732-Hohenheim 22 Dec 1797); m.Schwedt 29 Nov 1753 Friederike, Margravine of Brandenburg-Schwedt (Schwedt 18 Dec 1736-Stuttgart 9 Mar 1798)

1a) FRIEDRICH I Wilhelm Karl, took title Elector of Württemberg 25 Feb 1803, and King of Württemberg 26 Dec 1805 (Treptow 6 Nov 1754-Stuttgart 30 Oct 1816); m.1st Braunschweig 15 Oct 1780 Auguste, Dss of Braunschweig-Wolfenbüttel (Braunschweig 3 Dec 1764-Lohde, Estonia 27 Sep 1788); m.2d St.James's Palace 18 May 1797 Charlotte, Pss Royal of Great Britain, Ireland and Hannover (Buckingham House 29 Sep 1766- Ludwigsburg 6 Oct 1828)

1b) WILHELM I Friedrich Karl, King of Württemberg (Lübben 27 Sep 1781-Schloß Rosenstein 25 Jun 1864); m.1st Munich 8 Jun 1808 (div 1814) Charlotte Auguste Pss of Bavaria (Mannheim 8 Feb 1792- Vienna 9 Feb 1873); m.2d St.Petersburg 24 Jan 1816 Catherine, Grand Dss of Russia (St.Petersburg 21 May 1788-Stuttgart 19 Jan 1819); m.3d Stuttgart 15 Apr 1820 Pauline, Dss of Württemberg (4 Sep 1800-10 Mar 1873; below) .

1c) Marie Friederike Charlotte (Stuttgart 30 Oct 1816-Stuttgart 4 Jan 1887); m.Stuttgart 19 Mar 1840 Alfred Gf von Neipperg (Schwaigern 26 Jan 1807-Winnenden 16 Nov 1865)

2c) Sophie Friederike Mathilde (Stuttgart 17 Jun 1818-The Hague 3 Jun 1877); m.Stuttgart 18 Jun 1839 King Willem III of the Netherlands (Brussels 19 Feb 1817-Het Loo 23 Nov 1890)

3c) Katharina Friederike Charlotte (Stuttgart 24 Aug 1821-Stuttgart 6 Dec 1898); m.Stuttgart 20 Nov 1845 Friedrich Pr of Württemberg (21 Feb 1808-9 May 1870; below)

4c) KARL Friedrich Alexander, King of Württemberg (Stuttgart 6 Mar 1823-Stuttgart 6 Oct 1891); m.St.Petersburg 13 Jul 1846 Olga, Grand Dss of Russia (St.Petersburg 11 Sep 1822-Friedrichshafen 30 Oct 1892)

5c) Auguste Wilhelmine Henriette (Stuttgart 4 Oct 1826-Stuttgart 3 Dec 1898); m.Friedrichshafen 17 Jun 1851 Hermann Pr of Saxe-Weimar (Schloß Altenstein 4 Aug 1825-Berchtesgaden 31 Aug 1901)

2b) Friederike Catherine Sophie Dorothea (St.Petersburg 21 Feb 1783-Villa Monrepos, Lausanne 28 Nov 1835); m.Palais les Tuileries 22 Aug 1807 Jérôme Bonaparte, King of Westphalia (Ajaccio 15 Nov 1784- Paris 24 Jun 1860)

3b) Sophie Dorothea (St.Petersburg 24 Dec 1783-St.Petersburg 3 Oct 1784)

4b) Paul Heinrich Karl Friedrich August (St.Petersburg 19 Jan 1785-Paris 16 Apr 1852); m.Ludwigsburg 28 Sep 1805 Charlotte Pss of Saxe-Hildburghausen (Hildburghausen 17 Jun 1787-Bamberg 12 Dec 1847)

1c) Friederike Charlotte Marie, who took the name Elena Pavlovna on her Orthodox baptism (Stuttgart 9 Jan 1807-Stuttgart 2 Feb 1873); m.St.Petersburg 20 Feb 1824 Michael, Grand Duke of Russia (St.Petersburg 8 Feb 1798-Warsaw 9 Sep 1849)

2c) Friedrich Karl August (Schloß Comburg 21 Feb 1808-Stuttgart 9 May 1870); m.Stuttgart 20 Nov 1845 Katharine Pss of Württemberg (1821-1898; above)

1d) WILHELM II Karl Paul Heinrich Friedrich, King of Württemberg, abdicated 29 Nov 1918 (Stuttgart 25 Feb 1848-Schloß Bebenhausen 2 Oct 1921); m.1st Arolsen 15 Feb 1877 Marie Pss zu Waldeck und Pyrmont (Arolsen 23 May 1857-Villa Marienwahl, nr Ludwigsburg 30 Apr 1882); m.2d Bückeburg 8 Apr 1886 Charlotte Pss zu Schaumburg-Lippe (Ratiboritz 10 Oct 1864-Schloß Bebenhausen 16 Jul 1946)

1e) Pauline Olga Helene Emma (Stuttgart 19 Dec 1877-Ludwigsburg 7 May 1965); m.Stuttgart 29 Oct 1898 Friedrich Fst zu Wied (Neuwied 27 Jun 1872-Neuwied 18 Jun 1945)

2e) Christoph Ulrich Ludwig (Stuttgart 28 Jul 1880-Stuttgart 28 Dec 1880)

3c) Karl Paul Friedrich (Stuttgart 7 Mar 1809-Stuttgart 28 May 1810)

4c) Pauline Friederike Marie (Stuttgart 25 Feb 1810-Wiesbaden 7 Jul 1856); m.Stuttgart 23 Apr 1829 Wilhelm, Duke of Nassau (Kirchheimbolanden 14 Jun 1792-Kissingen 30 Aug 1839)

5c) Friedrich August Eberhard (Stuttgart 24 Jan 1813-Zehdenick, Berlin 12 Jan 1885); m.Marie Bethge, cr Frau von Wardenberg 14 Nov 1868 (Berlin 1 Apr 1830-Berlin 6 Feb 1869)

1d) Catharina Wilhelmine Helene Charlotte Auguste Hedwig von Wardenberg (Berlin 18 Apr 1865-Potsdam 25 Sep 1938); m.Berlin 2 Oct 1884 Dedo von Schenck (Schloß Mansfeld 11 Feb 1853-Wiesbaden 28 Apr 1918) .

2a) Ludwig Friedrich Alexander (Treptow 30 Aug 1756-Kirchheim unter Teck 20 Sep 1817); m.1st Siedlic, Poland 28 Oct 1784 (div 1792/3) Pss Maria Anna Czartoryska (Pulawy, Poland 15 Mar 1768-Vienna 21 Oct 1854); m.2d Schloß Ermitage 28 Jan 1797 Henriette Pss von Nassau-Weilburg (Kirchheimbolanden 22 Apr 1780-Kirchheim unter Teck 2 Jan 1857)

1b) Adam Karl Wilhelm Stanislaus Eugen Paul Ludwig (Pulawy 16 Jan 1792-Langenschwalbach 27 Jul 1847)

2b) Marie Dorothea Luise Wilhelmine Karoline (Karlsruhe 1 Nov 1797-Ofen 30 Mar 1855); m.Kirchheim unter Teck 24 Aug 1819 Joseph, Archduke of Austria (Florence 9 Mar 1776-Ofen 13 Jan 1847)

3b) Amalie Therese Luise Wilhelmine Philippine (Wallisfurth 28 Jun 1799-Altenburg 28 Nov 1848); m.Kirchheim 24 Apr 1817 Joseph, Duke of Saxe-Altenburg (Hildburghausen 27 Aug 1789-Altenburg 25 Nov 1868)

4b) Pauline Therese Luise (Riga 4 Sep 1800-Stuttgart 10 Mar 1873); m.Stuttgart 15 Apr 1820 King Wilhelm I of Württemberg (1781-1864; above)

5b) Elisabeth Alexandrine Konstanze (Riga 27 Feb 1802-Karlsruhe 5 Dec 1864); m.Stuttgart 16 Oct 1830 Wilhelm Pr of Baden (Karlsruhe 8 Apr 1792-Karlsruhe 11 Oct 1859)

6b) Alexander Paul Ludwig Konstantin (Kirchheim unter Teck 9 Sep 1804-Tuffer, Styria 4 Jul 1885); m.Vienna 2 May 1835 Claudine Gfn Rhédey von Kis-Rhéde, cr Gfn von Hohenstein 16 May 1835 (Erdöszentgyörgy 2 Sep 1812-Pettau 1 Oct 1841)
